summary.title: Website Threat Model
summary.description: This Flask blog application provides a web-based User Interface for dedicated/assigned users to register, log in, and manage blog posts. Communication is done through the backend utilizing HTTP/HTTPS APIs and data exchanges, enabling authentication, post creation, and retrieval. Login sessions should enforce authenticated access, while the database stores sensitive information such as user credentials, session details, and blog content. These assets collectively enable the blogâ€™s functionality and represent critical points requiring security protections.

diagrams.title: STRIDE diagram

data.name:
User Interface UI / 

Browser
data.description: The web pages (Jinja2 templates) served to users

threats.title: Generic Spoofing Threats
threats.description: Fake login attempts, credential theft, and fake front-ends.
threats.mitigation:
Use a vetted library or framework that does not allow this weakness to occur or provides constructs that make this weakness easier to avoid. For example, use anti-CSRF packages such as the OWASP CSRFGuard.

Generate a unique nonce for each form, place the nonce into the form, and verify the nonce upon receipt of the form. Be sure that the nonce is not predictable (CWE-330). Note that this can be bypassed using XSS.

Use the ESAPI Session Management control. This control includes a component for CSRF.

Do not use the GET method for any request that triggers a state change.

threats.title: Generic Repudiation
threats.description: Users deny login/logout without proper logging

data.name:
Login Session
Manager
data.description: Exchange of login credentials, Handles authentication, session tokens/cookies, and user identity

threats.title: Generic Spoofing threat
threats.description: Stolen or forged session tokens.

threats.title: Generic Repudiation threat
threats.description: Users deny login/logout without proper logging.

data.name: Database Server
data.description: Persistent storage containing users, posts, and comments.

threats.title: Generic Tampering Threat
threats.description: SQL injection, or unauthorized modifications
threats.mitigation:
Enforce the principle of least privilege
Use prepared statements and parameterized queries
Restrict network access database should not be directly accessible from the public internet

threats.title: Generic Spoofing Threat
threats.description: Fake clients pretending to be trusted apps.
threats.mitigation:
Use a standardized OAuth, token-based authorization framework
Implement Least Privilege permissions, such as using Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) to ensure that each API key or token has the minimum permissions necessary for its intended task.

data.name: External Apps
data.description: Connecting to any external app if necessary
data.reasonOutOfScope: This is still a testing/development stage

data.name: Data Boundary
data.description: This trust between Data and Webapp exchange.

data.name: SQL Queries
data.description: Request for  reading/writing posts, users, comments.

threats.title: Generic DoS Threat
threats.description: Query flooding or locking tables.
threats.mitigation: Implement time frame rate limiting, use WAF (web application firewall), and use parameterized queries instead of dynamically building SQL strings from user input.

data.name: Web App Queries Results
data.description: Response to Queries for reading/writing posts, users, comments.

threats.title: Generic Information disclosure Threat
threats.description: Database dump/leak of passwords or posts
threats.mitigation:
Ensure that all user inputs are properly validated and sanitized.
Implement strong authentication processes.

data.name: Fetch Data Exchange
data.description: External apps fetch data (posts, comments) or send data through APIs.

threats.title: Generic DoS Threat
threats.description: Excessive API requests

threats.title: Generic Information Disclosure Threat
threats.description: Overly verbose error messages or unsecured endpoints.

threats.title: Generic Tampering Threat
threats.description: Altering API request payloads

data.name: Session ID Response
data.description: Session validation requests and Logout / token invalidation

threats.title: Generic Information Disclosure Threat
threats.description: Session data leaked in transit.

threats.title: Generic Denial of service threat
threats.description: Flooding login/posts endpoints
threats.mitigation:
Set rate limiting
Implement a strict CSP that explicitly whitelists trusted sources for all content.

data.name: HTTP Response
data.description: Login response / returns HTML or JSON

threats.title: Generic Information Disclosure threat
threats.description: Leaked session cookies or error messages.

data.name:
Flask App / 

Web App
data.description: Python web application built using Flask.

threats.title: Generic Elevation of Privilege Threat
threats.description: Exploiting DB misconfigurations, weak API authentication, or authorization bypass.

threats.title: Generic Spoofing Threats
threats.description: A generic spoofing threat
threats.mitigation:
Ensure that the application is free of cross-site scripting issues. Most CSRF defenses can be bypassed using an attacker-controlled script.

Check the HTTP Referer header to see if the request originated from an expected page. This could break legitimate functionality, because users or proxies may have disabled sending the Referer for privacy reasons.

threats.title: Generic Tampering Threat
threats.description: This is a generic tampering threat, such as Malicious input (form injection, XSS)
threats.mitigation:
Ensure one of the Content-Security-Policy and X-Frame-Options HTTP headers is set on all web pages returned by your site/app.
Consider implementing Content Security Policy's "frame-ancestors" directive.

threats.title: Generic Repudiation threat
threats.description: A generic repudiation threat, such as users denying login/logout without proper logging.
threats.mitigation:
Inspect session management.
Ensure sensitive information is submitted via a POST request and not logged in server logs as part of a GET request.

threats.title: Generic Information disclosure Threat
threats.description: A generic Information disclosure Threat whereby Session data is leaked in transit.
threats.mitigation: Ensure web server, application server, load balancer, etc., are configured to set the Content-Security-Policy header.

threats.title: Generic DOS Threat
threats.description: A generic Denial of Service threat, like Flooding login/posts endpoints.

threats.title: Generic Elevation of Privilege Threat
threats.description: Exploiting DB misconfigurations, weak API authentication, or authorization bypass.

diagrams.description: The Flask blog system consists of a User Interface, APIs, Login Sessions, and a Database, connected by trust boundaries between the client, web server, and data storage.
